org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.admin.rdebug.client
Interface IAeEventHandler

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Implementing Classes:
AeActiveBpelEventHandlerStubAdapter, AeEventHandlerStub
public interface IAeEventHandler
extends java.rmi.Remote

Interface which defines the operations exposed by the remote debugger.

Method Summary

Method Detail

engineAlertHandler

public void engineAlertHandler(long aContextId,
                               long aProcessId,
                               int aEventType,
                               javax.xml.namespace.QName aProcessName,
                               java.lang.String aLocationPath,
                               javax.xml.namespace.QName aFaultName,
                               org.w3c.dom.Document aDetails,
                               java.util.Date aTimestamp)
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Event handler callbacl for engine alerts such as process suspending or faulting

Parameters:
aContextId - the context id used to locate the callback
aProcessId - the id of the process affected
aEventType - the event type
aProcessName - the name of the process
aLocationPath - location path of the activity causing the fault/suspension
aFaultName - the name of the fault that caused the alert
aDetails - optional details for the event
aTimestamp - the event's timestamp
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

engineEventHandler

public boolean engineEventHandler(long aContextId,
                                  long aProcessId,
                                  int aEventType,
                                  javax.xml.namespace.QName aProcessName,
                                  java.util.Date aTimestamp)
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Event handler callback for engine events, such as process creation and termination.

Parameters:
aContextId - the context id used to locate the callback
aProcessId - the id of the process affected
aEventType - the event type
aProcessName - the name of the process
aTimestamp - the event's timestamp
Returns:
true return indicates to suspend the associated process.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

processEventHandler

public boolean processEventHandler(long aContextId,
                                   long aProcessId,
                                   java.lang.String aPath,
                                   int aEventType,
                                   java.lang.String aFaultName,
                                   java.lang.String aText,
                                   javax.xml.namespace.QName aName,
                                   java.util.Date aTimestamp)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Event handler callback for process events, such as process state and info.

Parameters:
aContextId - the context id used to locate the callback
aProcessId - the id of the process affected
aPath - path of node affected by the event
aEventType - the event type
aFaultName - an optional fault name if fault event
aText - optional text
aName - The process' QName.
aTimestamp - the event's timestamp
Returns:
True if the process needs to be suspended, False otherwise
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

aEventType - the event type
aFaultName - an optional fault name if fault event
aText - optional text
aTimestamp - the event's timestamp

java.rmi.RemoteException

breakpointEventHandler

public void breakpointEventHandler(long aContextId,
                                   long aProcessId,
                                   java.lang.String aPath,
                                   javax.xml.namespace.QName aProcessName,
                                   java.util.Date aTimestamp)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Event handler callback for breakpoint events.

Parameters:
aContextId - the context id used to locate the callback
aProcessId - the id of the process affected
aPath - the node path where the breakpoint occurred.
aProcessName - the name of the process
aTimestamp - the event's timestamp
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
